Package de.hshl.obj.decode

Class Decoder<Builder>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshl.obj.decode.Decoder<Builder>
  • Type Parameters:
    Builder - 
    public class Decoder<Builder>
extends java.lang.Object
    A Decoder is a set of LineParsers. The LineParsers can be replaced or supplemented in order to customize the parsing of a file. That way, you can extend the functionality of the Decoder by adding your own LineParsers, in order to parse non-polygonal or completely custom OBJ lines. The decoder can be reused for multiple files. It can be used from multiple Threads, if it is not modified simultaneously. This Decoder class is used to de.hshl.obj.decode both OBJ and MTL files.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  Decoder.LineParser<Builder>
      The LineParser receives its target value as a mutable parameter, which it is supposed to modify by parsing the specified line.

      • decode

        public <T extends Builder> T decode​(T collector,
                                    java.nio.file.Path file)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Decode the de.hshl.obj.wavefront line by line, and write the results into 'builder'. Splits each line by whitespace and passes it to the appropriate line parser. The same Decoder can be used simultaneously to de.hshl.obj.decode two different files.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • decode

        public <T extends Builder> T decode​(T collector,

                             throws java.io.IOException
        Decode the buffered de.hshl.obj.data line by line, and write the results into 'builder'. Splits each line by whitespace and passes it to the appropriate line parser. The same Decoder can be used simultaneously to de.hshl.obj.decode two different files.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • decode

        public <T extends Builder> T decode​(T builder,
                                    java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> lines)
        Decode the de.hshl.obj.wavefront line by line, and write the results into 'builder'. Splits each line by whitespace and passes it to the appropriate line parser. The same Decoder can be used simultaneously to de.hshl.obj.decode two different files.
